title: Freedom4All
author: Freedom4All
content: I run a serious News and Opinion website with substantial, genuine traffic, and I am seeking advertisers/blog posters who are willing to pay to promote their product/service. That's my primary goal. I want to draw my readers into the world of cryptocurrency and giving the website a nice boost. A big specific group loves our content and the way we work en they are interested in cryptos as they feel their privacy comes to an end when they hear the plans about a centralized crypto run by the government.I want to monetize my website now, but with crypto-related products or services.Where shoud I post this to get the right people to read it?I followed some advise, I wrote casinos and exchangers but untill now I just found 1 small deal.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 28, 2023, 08:30:30 PMWhere shoud I post this to get the right people to read it?The  service board  is the right place for you to advertise your service. That's if you want to get paid on BTC and USD. But for other altcoins payment services, your service will be best advertise on the  Altcoins service discussion board  You then then use your created portfolio to search for your desire clients and share them your service Link

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.body: So you want to provide your promotional services related to the crypto market, i do liked your idea yes you can even get some clients from this forum as well but you need to provide proper details about your service and other details on the clients demands. For the proper lunch of your service you should create an ANN thread in the service section in marketplace. Remember trust is everything, try to gain some reputation in the community it will boost your clients, Hope you'll enjoy on the forum.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Services is where you should post it as it is the best suited for the type of thread you posted. As you can see from other post, it is true that trust is important when you offer a service and that's what will help you have a good reputation and having good reputation means that they trust you to do what they want. When that happen then both sides have benefited in it and you will have more clients in the future.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Well, you know what they say, there is no one-size-fits-all solution. Every website owner has gotta find their own way and figure out what works best for monetizing from their site. Some may find success through affiliate marketing, while others may prefer generating revenue through display ads.  If you are looking to offer your services, the Services section is the ideal place to do so. I recommend paying close attention to the content of your post. It is also important to include as much relevant information as possible so that potential clients can better understand the value and scope of your services. So, make sure to craft your post thoughtfully, making it as informative and engaging as possible.Quote from: Freedom4All on June 28, 2023, 08:30:30 PM~I followed some advise, I wrote casinos and exchangers but untill now I just found 1 small deal.Finding deals in the casino industry can be challenging. It is a competitive market, and it may take some time. Is your website somehow related to cryptocurrencies? Also, it is possible that potential clients don't see it as the right fit for their target audience. Or, perhaps you did not effectively presented your offer.

comments.author: Freedom4All
comments.created_time: June 28, 2023, 10:07:51 PMLast edit: June 30, 2023, 05:17:48 AM by mprep
comments.body: What I want is to keep the website free from AdSense and other advertising and affiliate programs. No GoogleAds. No Amazon Ads, no providers of platforms that connect websites and advertisers.The site is primarily visited by people who fear that everything is being centralized, including (digital) money. And they yearn for knowledge about bitcoins and how to get involved.I want to brainstorm with interested parties on what we can do to actually help our followers protect their privacy as much as possible.Our followers aren't crypto enthusiasts, but people who want to get to know and purchase cryptos as an alternative. My followers see that as freedom. And so do I.The followers aren't crypto experts, but people who want to get to know the crypto world and dive into it.Beginners, so to speak.And I hope to find a "match" here. Two dhonest individuals with different skills can conduct good business together in a fun and lawful manner. I see so many opportunities, but I need to start from scratch.[moderator's note: consecutive posts merged]

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: I will be true with you, that you need millions of views to your website, backlinks, good twitter account with huge following and then only you will be able to generate revenue from your website. Also, if you don't want to go with this way, just use Google AdSense, embed it into your blogs and you will start earning. It's much simpler than asking people to sponsor a post or buy a slot of advertisement on your blog.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: I see you have good intentions, OP and I think a number of your followers could like it. Hence if I may add, have you thought about setting up a donation system? From what you've told us, you've gained regulars so perhaps some of them would wanna chip in to support your endeavor. You could even try setting up some donator perks like exclusive contents. Do make sure that it's pretty visible though and not just something that exist on the footer.By the way, what's the website? Don't forget to include all the necessary information when you post an offer in Services board later.

comments.author: Freedom4All
comments.body: I have a donation system.It worked very well. At that time, I wasn't doing it for the money. I was really an activist, but working from home. In the beginning, I had no idea how to build websites or make YouTube channels. If I had known then what I know now...Here is the currently active donation intermediary:https://getfunded.nl/campagne/19678-commonsensetv-2-0-wij-zijn-terugYou must know that I spent years in a completely different world that has nothing to do with cryptocurrencies, and I had no clue about web designing, etc. I learned along the way.I had vowed not to write too much here. In our own comment section, I hardly ever react because I don't want to interfere and let people talk. Also because I know that you always get criticism. But on this website, I have already written a book, haha.I write in English and use a spellchecker. It should serve to express myself better. Ik hope it works.

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 28, 2023, 08:30:30 PMI want to monetize my website now, but with crypto-related products or services.Where shoud I post this to get the right people to read it?You have to build your website to have good traffics first. If your website has very low traffic, it is unrealistic to think you can monetize from it. Companies have abundant websites to choose and they surely consider cost and benefit from their marketing budget so they will pick best websites to spend money for advertisement or cooperation as well as partnership.You can build up your website by collaborating with influencers or build up educational contents about blockchain technology and cryptocurrency, trading courses, etc. Build it as an educational website needs a long time and you might give up before your website has good traffic enough for monetizing.
